title: 108_s2233
content: The Act may be cited as the "Environmental Research Enhancement Act" and pertains to Environmental Protection Agency research activities. The Environmental Research, Development, and Demonstration Authorization Act of 1979 is amended to establish the position of Deputy Administrator for Science and Technology in the Environmental Protection Agency, appointed by the President with Senate approval. The President appoints the Deputy Administrator for Science and Technology in the Environmental Protection Agency with Senate approval. Recommendations from the National Academy of Sciences, National Academy of Engineering, and Science Advisory Board are considered for the appointment. The Deputy Administrator for Science and Technology in the Environmental Protection Agency oversees the Office of Research and Development, the Office of Environmental Information, and the Science Advisory Board. The Deputy Administrator for Science and Technology in the Environmental Protection Agency is responsible for overseeing the Office of Research and Development, the Office of Environmental Information, the Science Advisory Board, the Science Policy Council, and scientific and technical activities in regulatory and regional offices. The Administrator for Science and Technology in the Environmental Protection Agency is responsible for identifying important scientific issues, developing an Agency-wide strategy for acquiring and disseminating scientific information. The Administrator for Science and Technology in the Environmental Protection Agency oversees scientific efforts involving academia, government agencies, and the private sector in the US and abroad to meet the Agency's scientific outreach and communication needs. The Administrator for Science and Technology in the Environmental Protection Agency coordinates scientific quality-assurance and peer-review activities Agency-wide, reaching out to the scientific community for relevant knowledge. The Administrator for Science and Technology in the Environmental Protection Agency oversees quality-assurance and peer-review activities to ensure valid scientific information is used in decision-making for regulatory decisions and policies. The Assistant Administrator for Research and Development in the Agency is appointed for a term of 6 years to ensure the validity, characterization, and application of scientific and technical information in regulatory decisions and policies. The Assistant Administrator for Research and Development in the Agency is appointed for a 6-year term. This provision applies to appointments made after the enactment of this subsection. Additionally, a program will be established to recruit and appoint senior researchers to the laboratories of the Office of Research and Development. The Office of Research and Development will establish a program to recruit senior researchers with distinguished achievements in environmental research. The head of the Office will make awards to support research in rapidly advancing areas related to the Agency's mission and to train junior researchers. The Office of Research and Development will establish a program to recruit senior researchers with distinguished achievements in environmental research. Awards will support research in rapidly advancing areas related to the Agency's mission and train junior researchers with exceptional promise. Selection procedures will be established, including consultation with the Science Advisory Board and the Board of Scientific Counselors. Awards have a specified duration. The Office of Research and Development will award grants for a 5-year period to senior researchers in each laboratory. Appropriations are authorized for this subsection. The Office of Research and Development is authorized to appropriate necessary funds for its activities, including granting flexibility and accountability to research managers. The Office of Research and Development aims to maintain a balance between core and problem-driven research, implement a strategy to acquire and apply research results from various sources, and align management practices with agency policy and strategic goals. The Administrator of the Agency shall improve documentation and transparency in decision-making processes for research priorities, assignments, and fund allocation. The Administrator of the Agency will increase efforts to disseminate research products, explain their significance, and assist others inside and outside the Agency. The Administrator will direct the Deputy Administrator for Science and Technology to expand the science inventory of the Agency by documenting and publishing a comprehensive inventory of all scientific activities conducted by Agency units. The Administrator will direct the Deputy Administrator for Science and Technology to expand the science inventory of the Agency by documenting all scientific activities conducted by Agency units, including project goals, milestones, schedules, principal investigators, project managers, staff and financial resource allocations, and ensure proper coordination through Agency-wide science planning. The Agency will ensure proper coordination of scientific activities through an Agency-wide planning process and peer review. The peer-review policy will be changed to increase independence from program managers. The position of Deputy Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency is now called "Deputy Administrator for Policy and Management of the Environmental Protection Agency". Any reference to the Deputy Administrator in laws, regulations, or other records will now refer to the Deputy Administrator for Policy and Management. The position of Deputy Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency has been renamed to "Deputy Administrator for Policy and Management of the Environmental Protection Agency" in laws and regulations. The Executive Schedule Level III has been updated to reflect this change.
